name: Taurus
origin: Zeus fell in love with Europa, a Phoenician princess, He transformed himself into a white bull and took her away to Crete.
visibility: Northern Hemisphere (Autumn and Winter) and Southern Hemisphere(Late Spring and Summer)

name: Libra
origin: The name Libra means “the weighing scales” , and the constellation represents the scales of justice held by Dike, the Greek goddess of justice, associated with Virgo constellation.
visibility: Northern Hemisphere(Early Spring to Mid Summer)and Southern Hemisphere( Autumn and Winter)

name: Aries
origin: Aries is identified as a winged ram with a golden fleece, sent by the nymph Nephele to save her son Phrixus after his father, King Athamas of Boeotia, had been given a false prophecy that he had to sacrifice his son to ward off famine.
visibility: Northern Hemisphere( Spring )and Southern Hemisphere( Autumn )

name: Scorpio
origin: Scorpius is one of the Greek constellations, first catalogued by Ptolemy. It represents the scorpion that killed the mythical hunter Orion.
visibility: Northern Hemisphere( Late Summer )and Southern Hemisphere(Late Spring to Early Autumn)

name: Cancer
origin: Cancer represents Karkinos, a crab sent by Hera to distract Heracles when he was fighting the Lemean Hydra as part of his Twelve Labours.
visibility: Northern Hemisphere(Autumn to Spring)and Southern Hemisphere( Summer and Autumn)

name: Virgo
origin: Virgo is associated with Dike, the Greek goddess of justice, holding the scales of justice represented by the neighbouring constellation Libra.
visibility: Northern Hemisphere(Early Spring to Mid Summer)and Southern Hemisphere( Autumn and Winter)

name: Sagittarius
origin: Sagittarius constellation represents a centaur aiming an arrow toward Antares, the bright star that marks the scorpion’s heart.
visibility: Northern Hemisphere(Mid Summer to Early Autumn)and Southern Hemisphere(Early summer to early Winter)

name: Capricorn
origin: The Capricorn means “the goat.” Capricornus is usually taken to represent the Greek forest deity Pan, who had the horns and legs of a goat.
visibility: Northern Hemisphere(Mid Summer to Early Winter ) and Southern Hemisphere ( Early Winter to late Spring )

name: Aquarius
origin: Aquarius is usually associated with Ganymede, the cu carrier to the Olympian gods.
visibility: Northern Hemisphere( Fall )and Southern Hemisphere( Spring )

name: Pisces
origin: Pisces is associated with a story about the goddess Aphrodite and her son Eros transforming themselves into fish to escape the monster Typhon.
visibility: Northern Hemisphere( Late Summer to Mid Winter )and Southern Hemisphere( Spring )

name: Gemini
origin: Gemini constellation was named after the mythical twins Castor and Polydeuces.
visibility: Northern Hemisphere(Winter and Spring)and Southern Hemisphere( Summer )

name: Leo
origin: Leo constellation is associated with the Nemean lion in Greek mythology, the beast killed by Heracles as part of his Twelve Labours.
visibility: Northern Hemisphere(Mid Winter to Early Summer)and Southern Hemisphere( Summer to Autumn)
